attributes.action: Scrap the idea to hand over maintenance responsibility from Network Rail to TOCs
attributes.background: Her Majesty's Government announced[1] a decision to instead of having a state run company maintaining Britain's rail network to instead hand over the responsibility to private TOC's. Her Majesty's Government has previously privatized the maintenance with disastrous results[2][3][4]
attributes.additional_details:
[1] http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2016/12/02/exclusive-network-rail-stripped-control-britains-train-tracks/

[2] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bexley_railway_station#History

[3] https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hatfield_rail_crash#Cause

[4]https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Potters_Bar_rail_accidents#2002

attributes.action: Fund the NHS more money so that ambulance response times improve
attributes.background: Ambulances take a long time to get to people. My Grandfather broke his leg and the ambulance didn't get to him till an hour after being called. If the ambulance had responded sooner then his pain would've been relieved quicker. Give more money to the NHS and stuff like this would be prevented

attributes.action: Make parking on pavement illegal so we wheelchair and pramchairs get through
attributes.background: When people have parked on pavement. We,  disabled with all sorts of wheelchair  can't get through to the narrow gap between the pavement and wall on the narrow street. That's including all sorts of pushchairs and pramchairs. So make it illegal by parking their cars on pavement anywhere in the UK

attributes.action: Call a referendum on the UK remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA).
attributes.background: The UK referendum rejected membership of the EU but voters were unable to express a preference for remaining in the European Economic Area (EEA - the Single Market). The most logical and democratic way to resolve this question is to have a new referendum with a new question.
attributes.additional_details: The EEA is the single market - it is Europe without Federalist aspirations. It allows the UK to trade freely with the EU. The UK is a signatory of this agreement and the "presumption of continuity" allows the UK to remain within the EEA if we so choose; there is no mechanism to eject us. The result of the EU referendum has been distorted and misinterpreted. The only thing we can conclude is that voters did not want to be part of the EU; EEA membership was not voted on.

attributes.action: Refund child maintenance if DNA testing proves a man isn't the biological Father
attributes.background:
My husband recently discovered that the child he has been raising for almost six years is not biologically his, following DNA testing.

As the Mother had always maintained that he was the father, he has been paying maintenance through the CSA for five years. 

He has no legal right to a refund.
attributes.additional_details:
The only way to attempt to get the money back is by claiming fraud in court which is costly, time consuming and not guaranteed. 

This is totally unfair and I believe the Mother should have a legal obligation to pay this money back via an attachment of earnings or a deduction of benefits, in the same way that Father's are forced to pay maintenance by the government.

Please sign this petition to have the issue debated in parliment, and bring about change in a system which unfairly favours women.

attributes.action: Government should stage a new cultural Festival of Britain
attributes.background: The Opening Ceremonies of the 2012 Olympic and Paralympic Games did much to tell the world what makes Britain Great.  Let's have a cultural Festival of Britain in this post Brexit climate to demonstrate what an amazing nation this is and that we continue to welcome the world
attributes.additional_details: Let's celebrate what makes this nation great in the ways that we did over 2012. Let's reach out and show the world what a vibrant and amazing country we live in, what we have to give to the world through culture and the wider creative sectors which lie at the heart of our thriving knowledge economy

attributes.action: Reduce teachers stress by limiting teaching contact hours to maximum 18hrs/ week
attributes.background: There have been many reports that teachers face too much stress and increasing workloads are reducing, not only the quality of teaching, but the mental health of our educators. Planning and assessing takes time. Teachers currently teach upto 25.5 hours which is too much with other duties needed.
attributes.additional_details: A 2015 study showed that 89% of 3500 teachers stated that workloads are a problem with 2/3 stating they are considering leaving. Teachers are not given a good work-life balance and often work at home because they do not have enough time to complete all tasks in normal working hours- with most reporting they work 60+ hrs /wk.  Teachers are currently expected to teach 25.5 hrs/wk. By legally reducing this to 18 classroom hours we can reduce stress and allow a more reasonable work week for teachers

attributes.action: Change the law to require all bus companies to offer free travel for children
attributes.background: In London 11 to 15 year olds currently get free travel. This should be available to all children nationally and the law should be changed to require bus companies to offer free travel to children nationally. This would reduce congestion & pollution as parents would encourage children to use buses.

attributes.action: Use funding used for TV's in prison cells for TV's for the elderly in hospital
attributes.background: Many elderly people who have fallen or become unwell, have no relations, comfort or entertainment in hospital, yet prisons continue to have TVs for prisoners, who have other entertainment, and social lives, this funding should be prioritised to help older or vulnerable people, with nothing else.
attributes.additional_details: After having worked for many years in the health care sector, I have seen many vulnerable adults with no family network endure a time in hospital with no comforts, family or friends, for someone elderly or with dementia this can be unfamiliar and scary, due to funding, TVs cannot be provided for beds in many hospitals around the UK, yet many prison cells have TVs, on top of a social life, a small allowance and more. These TV's could be used to make the day brighter for those with nothing else.

attributes.action: Parliament must approve the PM's plan for Brexit before Article 50 is invoked.
attributes.background: The Government’s plan for Brexit must be rigorously scrutinised by Parliament, before Article 50 is invoked. MPs should consider whether the Government’s plan is realistic, achievable, adequately manages risk and benefits all the people of Britain. MPs have a duty to ensure high quality planning.
attributes.additional_details: The Chilcot report describes the failures of government planning and inadequate Parliamentary scrutiny that led to the disastrous intervention in Iraq. Should Article 50 be invoked, without a plan scrutinised by parliament, as some propose, we could see a future enquiry coming to similar conclusions about Brexit.

attributes.action: Provide food, shelter, rehabilitation and caring for every homeless person
attributes.background:
The homeless situation in Britain is a terrible stain on our home nations.  Having anybody living on the streets in such a developed society is deplorable.

To let it happen because it is felt that people have fell through the cracks, don't try or have chosen their misfortune is unacceptable.
attributes.additional_details:
It is estimated that as much as 25% of homeless people are ex service personal.

People in derived areas are doubly jeopardised by not having life chances of an affluent, structured, stable upbringing and are more susceptible to finding themselves on the fringes of society.

This is the age of one nation Britain and we need to care and nurture all.

We would like to see Parliament open up homeless rehabilitation centres to be able to accommodate everybody on the streets, to get their life back

attributes.action: Make it illegal to discrimination against families when renting property.
attributes.background: Tennants with children are finding it increasingly difficult to rent a suitable, 2 bedroom property. Landlords and agents are using the unfair excuse that children cause extra wear on the property, yet a deposit is still taken to cover damages. It is leaving young families in difficult situations
attributes.additional_details:
My partner and I are currently facing homelessness after being served a section 21 on our flat. The landlord has decided to renovate the property, but will not allow children in it once it is finished. 
While searching for a new place for us to live, we are consistently met with the "No pets, No Children" statement.Like our daughter is as low as a dog! We live in an expensive area and are struggling to find suitable properties that allow children. 
I have contacted numerous agents and no differ.

attributes.action: We do not want a Norwegian EEC paid membership trade deal, or a Swiss deal.
attributes.background:
In the recent EU in/out referendum, the majority of the UK voted to leave the european union and we do not want a Norwegian or Swiss deal which would defeat the leave vote and why we voted leave.
We do not want to be a paid member of the EEC single market trading zone.
attributes.additional_details:
Some Conservative ministers have been reported by the BBC, Boris Johnson in particular of desiring a Norwegian trade zone membership deal against the interests of Britain and the majority of British voters who voted to leave europe and the single market.

Staying in the single market will do the economic damage David Cameron was talking about, and it will prevent us taking back control of our borders, immigration, fishing limits and full law making powers therefore it is against public interest.

attributes.action: Merge mental health with medical. 1 secure ward in every hospital.
attributes.background: Why is there not 1 secured ward which can be used where staff are trained to deal with mental illnesses in a hospital? Why are M/H patients not treated with the same respect as those without? Do they not deserve the same respect and compassion as someone who has not got M/H issues?
attributes.additional_details: Nearly 3 months ago my sister started to develop a symptoms that needed checking she and her staff were told it would get better. She was finally admitted into hospital and needed urgent treatment to save her life. When we arrived I advised staff how quickly things could escalate. I had to ring her M/H team to tell the doctors how to sedate her. She was discharged after having a cardiac arrest the morning prior and we still don't know what happened. Many things went wrong prior to her stay and whilst in that shouldn't be happening. I can only see that the reason she was discharged was because the hospital could not mange her mental illness. One secured ward in a hospital with trained staff would change this and allow mental health patients to receive the medical treatment they deserve.

attributes.action: Offer free 20 hours of childcare to all families, with children age 1 year plus.
attributes.background: There is a significant gap in the provision of childcare. Parents/carers are encouraged to return to work after averagely taking a year off after having a baby. But when working, they have little disposable income because it mainly goes on childcare.
attributes.additional_details: The Joseph's roundtree foundation has recently published findings which included: that 60% of in-work families are currently in poverty. Many social issues would be resolved if there were less financial and emotional strain on families. This type of policy would efficiently use all the talent lost when people start a family. It makes sense in these uncertain and difficult economic times. Let's make a difference to our future generations lives!

attributes.action: Make Statutory Maternity Pay 90% of average weekly earnings for 39 weeks
attributes.background: My husband and I are parents to a wonderful little girl named Daisy. We would love to have another child. Unfortunately, we know we will never be able to afford it with maternity pay being so low, i.e. £139.58 a week or less. Please support working parents
attributes.additional_details:
At the moment, statutory maternity pay (SMP) is paid for up to 39 weeks. You get: 
- 90% of your average weekly earnings (before tax) for the first 6 weeks 
- £139.58 or 90% of your average weekly earnings (whichever is lower) for the next 33 weeks

attributes.action: Make all foreign vehicles entering the UK pay a road tax.
attributes.background: When we drive across the channel we are expected to pay road tax in many European countries, either by way of motorway tolls, or by purchasing a vignette.  However, any vehicle can enter the UK from Europe and are able to travel free of road tax.  Why is this allowed to carry on?
attributes.additional_details: Vignettes could be purchased at the port of entry, or on line, in much the same way as the purchase system on the borders of Switzerland and Austria.  In Switzerland we have to purchase an annual vignette, and in Austria we are able to purchase a three month vignette.  Our roads are crammed with foreign trucks, and I strongly believe that some form of British road tax should be levied to ease the burden of the high road repair costs.

attributes.action: Ensure that all PIP assessment centres are accessible by those who cannot walk
attributes.background: Too many PIP assessment centres are not accessible to people with walking difficulties, in that the nearest car park is too far away, or the assessment rooms are not on the ground floor. The government needs to ensure all assessment centres have accessible parking and disabled lifts.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to direct hatred and abuse at any societal groups.
attributes.background: Racism and xenophobia have been legitimised in post-Brexit campaign Britain. We need to prevent extremist politicians, pressure groups and newspapers from inciting the hatred that has led to children being called 'vermin' and told to 'go home', and offensive slogans appearing in our cities.
attributes.additional_details: We would like Parliament to pass legislation making it illegal to target ANY group of people with hate messages, whether spoken, written or pictorial, so that politicians, pressure groups and newspapers can no longer use sensationalist headlines that scapegoat specific groups in society and make them a target for racism, xenophobia and other forms of hatred and abuse.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to Trigger Article 50 and repeal EC Act 1972.
attributes.background: We live in a Democracy and the EU Referendum result should be honoured by the Government.  Article 50 of the Lisbon Treaty must be triggered and the European Communities Act 1972 should be repealed.

attributes.action: Legalise medical marijuana for chronic and terminal conditions
attributes.background: Many people in the UK suffer from painful and life-threatening conditions, such as cancer, MS, and Parkinsons.; the synthetic drugs prescribed can have nasty side effects. Research from around the world has shown that medical marijuana can improve quality of life, with fewer side effects.
attributes.additional_details:
60 peer reviewed studies of medical marijuana
http://medicalmarijuana.procon.org/view.resource.php?resourceID=000884
United States FDA report
https://www.drugabuse.gov/publications/drugfacts/marijuana-medicine

attributes.action: To give assistant/therapy dogs the same recognition as Guide and Hearing dogs.
attributes.background: Guide/Hearing Dogs are recognised by shops to give them admission. However, therapy and assistance don't have the rights to enter establishments with those they support, this disadvantages the person the dog is with. I am looking to give these useful dogs the same recognition in law.

attributes.action: Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU; keeping UK in EU.
attributes.background:
Partition 7 new British Crown Dependencies out of UK and EU so Leavers can Leave EU. Keep post-Partition UK a full EU member state (do not activate Art.50) so Remainers can Remain in EU.
Precedents: Isle of Man, Jersey & Guernsey are BCDs outside EU.
When Greenland left Denmark, Denmark stayed EU
attributes.additional_details:
Full Petition Text & Detailed List of the 7 new BCDs' areas (with % Leave vote figures): http://tinyurl.com/ntg88ta
Maps of 7 BCDs: 
http://tinyurl.com/orygvny 
http://tinyurl.com/ogb3qnk
Further:
UK Govt to assign finance & civil servants to help each of new BCDs get its Govt / Parliament set up.
Defence still by UK; major roads, rail, power grids & nuclear reactors stay UK territory; later on BCDs contribute finances. 
Reciprocal NHS Arrangement between BCDs & UK (like Isle of Man & UK now).

attributes.action: Increase the minimum wage for young adults under the age of 18
attributes.background: The minimum wage being £3.87 for 16 and 17 year olds can not only put young people off working, but also reduces their financial independence. It should be raised to at least £4.50 so these under 18 year olds can get a worthwhile and rewarding payment for their labour time.

attributes.action: Make smear tests accessible at the age of consent, as opposed to at aged 25.
attributes.background: The legal national age for consent is 16. Smear tests aren't available until the age of 25. Meaning that any given woman could go for up to 9 years, without being screened for abnormal and dangerous cells.
attributes.additional_details: HPV, for example is contracted through sexual activity and is a leading cause for cervical cancer. Regardless of age, anyone can contract HPV and although it is now immunised for in most teenage girls, many women have no idea of the damage it causes before it's too late. A cervical screen test / smear test - is a method of detecting abnormal cells on the cervix. The cervix is the entrance to the womb from the vagina. Detecting and removing abnormal cervical cells can prevent cervical cancer.

attributes.action: Abolish or reduce Vehicle Excise Duty (Road Tax) for Motorcycles
attributes.background: As most Motorcycles cover minimal annual mileage, have low emissions, help reduce congestion and do little damage to roads, it is unfair that owners have to pay between £17 and £82 tax per year whilst a significant number of cars pay none and many paying only £30 per year.

attributes.action: Fund Home Schooling For SEN Children that cannot access mainstream schools
attributes.background: My two children have autism spectrum disorder and also suffer with anxiety. They find going into the school impossible. Since taking them out of school they are doing fantastic. But this as caused us to reduce our working hours and causes us financial problems. All we need is a little help
attributes.additional_details: If like with in elderly care a percentsge of the money set aside for a childs education could be paid to parents to home educate a child with special educational needs. It would enable child to recieve a good quality home education and relieve the financial burdon on the family.

attributes.action: Demand the EU accounts are fully disclosed. Not been audited in 20 years.
attributes.background: The accounts going back to 1994 have shown material errors, and apparently from 1994 - 2006, they have been "not entirely" fair or accurate.  Are these accounts ever released for public scrutiny? It's administered by the EU's own "Court of auditors" who give their opinion. Their own people? Why?
attributes.additional_details:
https://fullfact.org/europe/did-auditors-sign-eu-budget/

Let's see the accounts and let 'our' auditors have a look at them.  Make things open and transparent.  Or isn't that allowed in the EU?

attributes.action: Stop the UK from recognising child marriage conducted abroad as legal.
attributes.background:
The UK recognises child marriage provided they were conducted "legally" abroad & also for benefit purposes.
It is illegal to marry under 18 yrs of age in the UK (16 years with parental consent) & these child marriages should not be recognised by the UK in any form. The adult should be prosecuted.
attributes.additional_details:
Today Save the Children estimated that a girl marries under the age of 15 years every 7 second seconds within the world.
In recognising the child marriages of immigrants to the UK (including for benefit purposes) we do nothing to stop this child abuse.

attributes.action: Facilitate 100% mortgages for those renting privately.
attributes.background: There is gap in the 'help to buy' scheme that doesn't facilitate those people who are stuck in the private rental market.  People that regularly evidence the ability to make mortgage payment, but do not have the ability to put away enough savings to reach a 5-10% deposit.
attributes.additional_details: There is a next generation issue, of those people that have young families but are now stuck in the rental market.  Quite often the rental costs are higher than what a mortgage would cost, but due to the often higher rental changes to facilitate a family home these people can not accrue enough savings quickly enough to purchase a property.

attributes.action: Free sanitary products in homeless centres and open clinics.
attributes.background: Having a period at home at the best of times isn't pleasant. Along with worrying about getting blood on clothing, women must battle cramps and a hormonal rollercoaster. Doing this as a homeless woman is far worse due to a lack in sanitary facilities and privacy.
attributes.additional_details:
We estimate that women spend around £5070 on their period between the ages of 12 and 51. 
In addition sanitary products are considered luxury items so are subject to an additional 5% tax. Mens razors are not included in this luxury tax. Considered that a women will use an average of 11,000 tampons (alone) in their lifetime, can this really be justified?

attributes.action: Require that all new build properties be fitted with solar PV panels at build.
attributes.background: Solar (PV) power as an important and easily achieved form of renewable energy. PV panels fitted at build keeps costs low, helping to reduce the need for large power generation such as at Hinkley Point. New battery storage systems mean this power would be available even after sundown.

attributes.action: Make RAF Mildenhall a Theme Park/Water Park or Shopping Centre.
attributes.background: RAF Mildenhall is shutting shop in 2022 so let's turn it into something useful for the community. Not an Airport not more houses something for the local community and economy

attributes.action: Make driving a Motorcycle with no protective clothing / leathers illegal.
attributes.background: My Dad was involved in a serious bike accident, which bought home to our family the seriousness and how dangerous it can really be. I am tired of seeing people riding motorcycles with just a helmet, I cannot watch another family go through what we have.

attributes.action: I want the Meningitis B vaccination to be free for everyone in the UK
attributes.background: Recently whilst on holiday in Barcelona I fell ill with bacterial meningitis. As a child I was not offered the vaccination which could have potentionally prevented me from getting this horrific and life threatening disease. Instead of having a three day holiday I was in hospital for two weeks.
attributes.additional_details: I want this strain of meningitis to be prevented by the vaccination being available to everyone that may need it.  I understand babies are now being given the vaccination. But all others that are not vaccinated are still at risk and deserve to be prevented for free!!!

attributes.action: Free blood tests for people putting themselves forward as Living Donors.
attributes.background:
If someone is willing to be a Living Donor, undergo invasive surgery to change peoples lives, and at the same time save the NHS money - surely, we can provide them a blood group certificate on the NHS and not ask them to pay for it? 
It's a selfless act, & being forced to go private is prohibitive.
attributes.additional_details:
I've lived with CKD for ten years, and now I am in need of a transplant or face years of dialysis. I am so lucky that a group of people have come forward as potential Living Donors.

These people are willing to undergo invasive surgery to change lives. This surgery would also save the NHS millions, transplanting kidneys is more cost efficient than dialysis. 

It's the principle - if someone is willing to undertake such a selfless act, as a society let's not ask them to pay for the privilege.

attributes.action: Fireworks should only be allowed with a specific liecence per event
attributes.background:
Fireworks can cause injury to bystanders.  
Fireworks cause distress people's pets. 
Fireworks should only be ignited by a pyrotechnics person.
Fireworks should not be allowed on private property they should only be allowed in a designated public area with a specific license per event.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the risks fireworks bring it is requested that they are only ignited by a professional pyrotechnics person.  They should only be allowed in designated public places. They should require a licence from the local council. This will safe guard children and animals and ensure this safety risk and noise pollution is managed in a fair socially considered manner

attributes.action: Teach about lesbian-specific protection in schools.
attributes.background: While every school teaches students to use a condom to protect from pregnancy and STI's, very few even mention lesbian-specific protection.  Young women should be formally educated on the risks they face when engaging in same-sex sexual activities and how best to avoid them.
attributes.additional_details:
I was shocked to learn at the age of eighteen (two years after the age whereby one can consent to having sex) that lesbian-specific protection exists. 

From asking people on my social media, only 18/100 people were taught about this protection in school, while 32/100 knew it existed.  

There is a call for homosexual sex-ed lessons in schools, but lesbian protection should be taught as a priority as a matter of promoting safe sex.  Everyone should know how to protect themselves and stay safe.

attributes.action: Work with governments in other countries to take action against child soldiers
attributes.background:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against.
#ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou
attributes.additional_details:
We are currently doing our GCSE citizenship coursework and have had to research what we would like to take action against. 
 We decided child soldiers as children younger than us are being kidnapped and forced to become soldiers. This is something we feel strongly and passionate about as it is something that affects children and their lives. #ItCouldHaveBeenUs 
#ItCouldHaveBeenYou

attributes.action: Review above inflation interest rates applied to Plan2 Student Loans in England
attributes.background:
The Plan2 annual rate of interest while students are studying is RPI plus 3% and continues to be above RPI unless earnings stay below £21,000.
Previous Plan2 %rates (Plan1 pre-2012) are:
2012/13	 6.6% (1.5%)
2013/14	 6.3% (1.5%)
2014/15    5.5% (1.5%)
2015/16	 3.9% (0.9%)
2016/17	 4.6% (1.25%)
attributes.additional_details:
The uncertain economic future after the EU Referendum leaves Plan2 borrowers vulnerable. In addition, there is the looming threat of the Plan2 student loan book being sold to a private sector financial institution. 
This petition asks the government to review Plan2 student loans to remove above inflation interest rates and introduce a cap; thus protecting English students from becoming “an indentured class of graduates from whom higher repayments can be extracted.” (McGettigan, A)  @plan2fight

attributes.action: Instigate a 2nd EU referendum, honestly campaigned and to include 16-17 yr olds
attributes.background:
EU Membership is too important to be decided by a vote based on inaccurate campaign claims and which excluded 16-17yr olds.
The EU referendum result is not legally binding. Cameron decided that the UK should be bound by it but has subsequently resigned. His decision can & should be rescinded.
attributes.additional_details:
•	The percentage difference between Leave and Remain was not great enough to trigger such a momentous course of action - 48% voted Remain 
•	16 & 17yr olds were not included - their future is at stake & their votes should be counted
•	Voters may have been swayed by false information - eg the Leave campaigners have acknowledged their NHS claims were inaccurate. All campaign claims should be regulated by the Advertising Standards Authority to ensure accuracy and honesty for both parties.

attributes.action: Adopt a zero tolerance approach to acts of racism, in the wake of the referendum
attributes.background: Since the EU referendum, there have been numerous accounts of racism and xenophobia, where people who are in the UK legally are being abused, assaulted and/or told to "go home". A zero tolerance stance is required to show that racism and xenophobia has no place in the UK, whether in the EU or not.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/entry/eu-referendum-racism_uk_576fe161e4b08d2c56396075

attributes.action: Establish an independent inquiry into Child Sexual Exploitation in Telford
attributes.background: Telford & Wrekin has more reports of Child Sexual Exploitation per capita than anywhere else in the UK. There are 15 reports per 10,000 people in Telford & Wrekin compared to 6.4 in Rotherham. An independent inquiry would establish (as it did in Rotherham) the facts behind this disturbing statistic.
attributes.additional_details: Telford has been described as the "child sex capital of Britain". There could be as many as 2,300 victims in Telford & Wrekin - 40% more than Rotherham's 1,400 - based on being 2 and a half times more likely to be a victim in Telford & Wrekin which has 60% of the population of Rotherham.

attributes.action: End all government subsides and other financial aid to the fossil fuel industry.
attributes.background: The UK government provides the domestic fossil fuel industry with funds to the tune of £6 billion annually. This industry, endangering all of us by intensifying climate change, is getting money from our government at the expense of the taxpayer. This has to stop before it is too late.
attributes.additional_details:
Direct subsides are hard to calculate –  Reasonable mid-range figure is £6 billion annually, given by widely trusted sources such as the Independent and the Overseas Development Institute(ODI) however the UK claims not to have any using an irrational definition. The International Monetary Fund puts the figure much higher at £26b.
This petition's specific demand is that fossil fuel subsides, as defined by the ODI are to be abolished by 2020 and the extra revenue should be invested in clean energy.

attributes.action: Reinstate the weekly Widows' Pension (abolished in April 2001)
attributes.background: The weekly Widows' Pension was abolished in April 2001 and now the Conservative Government are delaying the payment of our State Pension which we and our employers have paid into and which is rightfully ours.

attributes.action: Enforce dog licences for everyone pet owners and breeders. Toughen up on laws!
attributes.background: Everyone should be registered on a database & buy a dog licence that wants to own one! Anyone breeding be it once or several times should have to be checked by an authority to show they are equipped and have the education to do it properly, the laws need to be toughened up on those who abuse them!
attributes.additional_details: The increase in puppy prices is soring, in turn there are more irresponsible breeders and owners breeding just to make quick cash! they're not been bred for health or temprement, this is causing rescues to overflow as these puppies are growing into unhealthy untrainable and some cases dangerous dogs. This petition is to enforce licences on all dog owners and breeders and make them liable for any consequences of their dogs! Those caught not been licenced need prosecuting or jail!

attributes.action: Invest in Tidal power instead of Dangerous Nuclear Energy
attributes.background:
UK Govt. to Invest in the creation of the Severn barrage and scrap plans for Hinkley Point. The Severn project is renewable, clean energy, it will also provide 5% of the UK's energy requirements, create 50,000 jobs and can be built within just 10 years. 
Nuclear is dirty, profit driven & dangerous.
attributes.additional_details:
Some facts & quotes about the project.

''The electricity generated would be equivalent to three or four nuclear power stations and thousands of wind turbines & equivalent to 8 large coal-fired power stations. ''

- Lower cost than Hinkley Point.

- The barrage will have an operational lifetime of up to 200 year.

- It would be the world's largest ever renewable energy project.

-  Damages to wildlife from project can be avoided with additional investment of £3 Billion to migrate wildlife.

attributes.action: The Government  inaugurates a system to record all entry and exit to Britain.
attributes.background: It is becoming obvious that it is only fair to allow existing migrants to stay provided they are contributing but this must NOT include new migrants since Brexit has been decided upon.  The Government must insist that all subsequent visitors/migrants have passports with biometric information within.
attributes.additional_details: All new British Passports issued have a 'chip' embedded and many other Countries too have biometric information which is essential for proper registration of those entering and leaving Britain.  It has been used to great effect in the US and Britain must have the same security measures.  Such a requirement should not be seen as discriminatory by the EU as British Citizens are required to have the same information.  Mrs May has failed to install a system as Home Secretary and must rectify as PM.

attributes.action: Open negotiations to join the Schengen Area.
attributes.background: Switzerland, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein are in Schengen without being in the EU. Schengen allows for free movement and common visa policy across Europe, without requiring welfare support for immigrants, and provides for police and judicial cooperation to fight transnational crime.
attributes.additional_details: The UK has voted to leave the European Union but many people, especially young people in Britain, value being able to travel and work freely across Europe. We value the contribution that visitors and residents from elsewhere in Europe make to our economy and society. We will likely be required to agree to freedom of movement as part of any deal to join the European Economic Area or EFTA. We could start negotiating to join Schengen before triggering formal negotiations to leave the EU.

attributes.action: Refuse any request for another Scottish independence referendum before May 2020
attributes.background: The constitution is a reserved matter and therefore no consent should be given to another Scottish referendum before May 2020.
attributes.additional_details: The Scotland Act 1998 states that the constitution is a reserved matter therefore consent has to be given by Westminster before any future Scottish independence referendum could take place.
